abstract: Tenet Healthcare said on Friday that its board had rejected a revised $3.3 billion takeover offer from Community Health Systems.
snippet: Tenet Healthcare said on Friday that its board had rejected a revised $3.3 billion takeover offer from Community Health Systems.
lead_paragraph: Tenet Healthcare said on Friday that its board had rejected a revised $3.3 billion takeover offer from Community Health Systems. Community revised its offer on Monday, saying that it would convert its bid of $5 cash and $1 in stock to an all-cash offer of $6 a share. The original unsolicited offer, announced in December, represented a premium of 40 percent to Tenet’s stock price at the time. The revised proposal, Tenet said on Friday, still “grossly undervalues” the company. In a letter to Wayne T. Smith, the chief executive of Community, Trevor Fetter, the chief executive of Tenet, said that the bid undervalued Tenet and that he had concerns about disclosure and regulatory compliance. Community said it was disappointed by Tenet’s rejection but was “ready to engage in constructive discussions to move this transaction forward.”

headline.main: Tenet Healthcare Rejects a Higher Takeover Bid
headline.print_headline: Tenet Healthcare Rejects a Higher Takeover Bid
